intro: Draba cheiranthoides, commonly known as the Alpine Draba, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cold, high-altitude climates. It produces small, rounded seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its colonization of remote habitats. Draba cheiranthoides is often found in meadows and scree slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
